head.title: Sept. 24-30; Denmark Rejects the Euro In Blow to European Unity

hedline.hl1: Sept. 24-30; Denmark Rejects the Euro In Blow to European Unity

block.p: In the first popular test for Europe's common currency, Denmark voted to reject the euro 53.1 percent to 46.9 percent. The rejection suggested that the euro was likely to remain weak and dealt a blow to the political project of European unification behind the currency. With Britain and Sweden, the other two European Union states not inside so-called Euroland, now unlikely to adopt the euro any time soon, the European Central Bank faces the daunting task of forging confidence in a currency that has no single government or unified fiscal policy behind it.
